title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.2: HIGH QUALITY EDUCATION, INCLUDING ALTERNATIVE PATHWAYS

description.narrative: Output 2.2: Improved capacity of the Ministry of Education and Training to provide high quality education, including alternative pathways., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Evaluation And Research, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2:By the end of 2023, adolescents (10 to 19 years), particularly the most vulnerable, benefit from gender-responsive quality health, HIV, learning and protection services.

sector.narrative: Education Management Information System (EMIS) (excluding learning assessment systems)
Education Management Information System (EMIS) (excluding learning assessment systems)
Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of primary education teacher training
Provision or procurement of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) learning materials
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
System strengthening - mainstreaming of skills development within national education/training system
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.2: Improved capacity of the Ministry of Education and Training to provide high quality education, including alternative pathways.

description.narrative: UNICEF provided technical and financial support to MOET to revise the Education Sector Plan and develop a COVID-19 education response plan. A GPE COVID-19 Accelerated Grant of 3,470,000 USD was received to implement the plan, including the broadcasting of TV and radio lessons for learners who are home during school closures since early April 2020. Good progress was made to improve EMIS data collection and management while inclusive education activities were delayed due to COVID-19. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of children supported with distance/home-based learning [COVIDSitRep]
System Strengthening - Gender - National education sector plan/policies support gender-responsive environments - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - EMIS - National EMIS provides quality and timely data - score (1-4), see guidance
